summary: Email exchange between FBI Special Agent Sean Watson and Assistant U.S. Attorney Lauren Schorr Potter regarding scheduling a call, with Watson noting he was delayed due to being 'pulled out of town on the Epstein case.'

persons.context: Assistant U.S. Attorney with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, initiating contact to schedule a call.

connections.description: Corresponding about scheduling a call, with Watson referencing his work on the Epstein case.

events.title: Email exchange regarding Epstein case work
events.description: FBI Special Agent Sean Watson emails Assistant U.S. Attorney Lauren Schorr Potter to apologize for delay, citing being 'pulled out of town on the Epstein case.'

keyFacts: FBI Special Agent Sean Watson was actively working on the Epstein case as of July 2020.
The email indicates ongoing investigation activities requiring travel ('pulled out of town').
The communication is between FBI and U.S. Attorney's Office personnel, showing inter-agency coordination.
The email is dated July 6, 2020, after Epstein's death in August 2019, indicating continued investigation.
